02:57~03:00  The scene ends with everyone laughing.

movie101_6965768652251628068_600_780:
00:00~00:02 The scene takes place at a wedding. Ma Dongmei, wearing a white dress and a pink sun visor, is angrily confronting her husband, Xia Luo. Xia Luo, wearing a white shirt, is being held back by two friends.
00:02~00:19 Ma Dongmei complains to Xia Luo about how she has been working hard to save money while he disassembled her engine. She expresses her disappointment and frustration with his actions. The friends try to calm them down.
00:19~00:49 Ma Dongmei recalls the day they got married. There was no ceremony, and Xia Luo only took her to eat lamb spine. She questions his sincerity and asks if he thinks she's exaggerating. As she gets more and more upset, she pushes Xia Luo, and the scene turns into chaos.
00:49~01:12 Ma Dongmei demands Xia Luo to stay and tells the others to stop him from leaving. The friends try to restrain Xia Luo, but he breaks free and runs out of the wedding venue, leaving Ma Dongmei behind.
01:12~01:21 Xia Luo, feeling humiliated and defeated, runs away from the wedding venue. He reflects on how he is always a joke and how his wife has made him feel worthless. He feels lost and doesn't know what he wants in life.
01:22~01:55 Xia Luo enters a luxurious bathroom. He splashes water on his face, looks at his reflection in the mirror, and punches it, breaking the glass. He feels trapped and desperate.
01:56~02:15 Xia Luo lies on the toilet bowl, crying and feeling utterly defeated. He looks at his reflection in the broken mirror and whispers "Divorce". He leaves the bathroom with a determined look.
02:16~02:31 Xia Luo walks out of the bathroom, shielding his eyes from the bright light. He walks towards the camera, his eyes filled with pain and confusion.
02:31~02:47 The scene shifts to Xia Luo, still in his wedding attire, standing in a bright, empty room. He is startled by a voice calling for "Mom". It seems like a flashback to his childhood. Teacher Wang, holding a ruler, enters the scene and angrily asks Xia Luo where his mother is.
02:48~03:00 Xia Luo looks confused and frightened. Teacher Wang, growing impatient, tells Xia Luo to shut up and leaves the room. Xia Luo stands there, sweating and gasping for air, trying to make sense of what's happening. He looks up, completely bewildered and desperate.
movie101_6965768652251628068_780_960:
00:00~00:08 Xia Luo wakes up in a classroom. Teacher Wang, standing before a blackboard filled with writing, asks Xia Luo if he has amnesia. Xia Luo is confused and doesn't know his last name.
00:08~00:22 Laughter erupts in the classroom as Teacher Wang berates Xia Luo for his amnesia and demands he leaves to find his mother.
00:22~00:35 Teacher Wang continues to scold Xia Luo, telling him to stop pretending and get out. He walks through the silent classroom toward Xia Luo.
00:35~00:50 The scene cuts to a close-up of a school desk with anime stickers and notebooks. As Teacher Wang reaches the desk, he notices the stickers and stares intensely at Xia Luo and another student, Yuan Hua, who is sitting beside him with a sullen expression.
00:50~00:57 Xia Luo mutters that this dream feels too real. Teacher Wang loses his temper, questioning Xia Luo's disrespect and lack of school uniform.
00:57~01:17 Xia Luo reveals he attended a wedding, leading Teacher Wang to inquire about whose wedding it was, suspecting it was Xia Luo's mother getting remarried. The class bursts into laughter again.
01:17~01:44 Teacher Wang angrily orders the class to stop laughing and continues scolding Xia Luo. He then discovers a love letter in Xia Luo's pocket and demands he read it aloud, humiliating him further by making him reveal it is addressed to Ma Dongmei, a female classmate. Ma Dongmei, overcome with embarrassment, leaves the classroom.
01:45~02:06 Teacher Wang criticizes Xia Luo for hurting people with his actions and mocks Da Chun, another student, for ranking second last in the class. Xia Luo throws the letter in the air, defying Teacher Wang's order to read it.
02:06~02:17 Xia Luo, fueled by anger and humiliation, suddenly attacks and beats Teacher Wang. The shocked class watches in stunned silence as chaos erupts.
02:17~02:37 Xia Luo, standing over the defeated Teacher Wang, vents his frustration about the constant ranking and pressure. He claims that even if they all become failures, it will be Teacher Wang's fault.
02:37~02:42 Teacher Wang, shaken and frightened, asks Yuan Hua, a large and imposing student, what he is going to do. Yuan Hua, equally agitated, says he doesn’t know.
02:42~02:49 Other students try to stop the fight, questioning Xia Luo's actions and asking who hit the teacher.  Teacher Wang demands to know who attacked him.
02:49~02:56 Amid the confusion, Yuan Hua pushes past everyone, heading for the door. He announces he is going to get the principal.
02:56~03:00 The scene ends with the class in disarray, some trying to restrain Xia Luo and others looking on in fear and confusion.

00:00~00:03 Da Chun, wearing a tiger-print T-shirt and a helmet, smiles and teases his friend Xia Luo, sitting in a car, about having some money and not knowing how to flaunt it.
00:04~00:16 Xia Luo, wearing a colourful sweater, invites Da Chun to go have fun, offering to pay for whatever they do. He asks Da Chun if he can drive, and Da Chun confidently confirms he can. Da Chun then gets in the car and drives off, crashing through a wall. 
00:17~00:23 Da Chun, panicked, tells Xia Luo that he thinks he hit someone's car and urges him to leave quickly to avoid paying compensation. They abandon the car, leaving behind a sunflower that had been decorating its flatbed, and walk away.
00:24~00:30 They arrive at an arcade. Xia Luo, disappointed, comments on Da Chun's lack of ambition for picking such a low-key place. Da Chun, unfazed, tells him to shut up and buy tokens.
00:30~00:36 Inside the arcade, they play a fighting game. Da Chun wins the game decisively, knocking down Xia Luo's character. 
00:37~00:46 Da Chun celebrates his victory, excitedly telling Xia Luo that he'd practiced for years to finally defeat him. Xia Luo remains silent, visibly annoyed.
00:47~00:51 Da Chun, in a patronizing tone, asks Xia Luo if he can’t handle losing and tells him not to be a sore loser. He offers to make it up to him by catching a toy for him later.
00:52~00:59 Xia Luo, looking up at Da Chun, says he's jealous of him for being able to live like a carefree fool. 
01:00~01:05 Da Chun, taken aback, asks Xia Luo what he means and how he could possibly be jealous of him. He reminds Xia Luo that he seems to have everything he could ever want. 
01:06~01:09 Xia Luo, with a hint of sadness, reveals that the woman he loves has been taken by someone else.
01:10~01:16 Da Chun, outraged, asks who would dare to steal Xia Luo's woman. Xia Luo, looking downcast, reveals that it was his best friend who took her.
01:17~01:27 Da Chun, filled with righteous anger on behalf of his friend, urges Xia Luo to call his friend and confront him. He offers to yell at the friend on Xia Luo’s behalf. Xia Luo takes Da Chun’s phone and calls his friend.
01:28~01:55 Da Chun receives a phone call and steps away to answer it, leaving Xia Luo on the phone with his friend. Xia Luo hangs up the phone and looks distraught. 
01:56~02:01 Da Chun finishes his phone call and turns around to face Xia Luo, who punches him in the face. Da Chun falls to the ground unconscious. An ambulance with flashing lights drives through the city at night. 
02:02~02:10 The scene cuts to a hospital waiting room at night. Yuan Hua, pacing anxiously, asks the Doctor about Xia Luo's condition. Qiu Ya, dressed in a black blazer and red top, asks the Doctor if Xia Luo's injury will affect his creative work, assuming the Doctor knows who Xia Luo is.
02:11~02:20 The Doctor asks everyone to calm down and then reveals that they found HIV in Xia Luo's blood. Yuan Hua, Zhang Yang, and Meng Te, dressed in a black off-shoulder top and red shoes, are shocked. 
02:21~02:25 Qiu Ya expresses relief, stating that at least Xia Luo’s brain is fine, seemingly unconcerned about the HIV diagnosis. Meng Te is visibly puzzled.
02:26~02:33 Qiu Ya, realizing what the Doctor said, asks in disbelief if he means HIV, thinking it’s the same as bird flu. 
02:34~02:38 Zhang Yang explains to Qiu Ya that the Doctor is talking about AIDS.
02:39~02:45 Qiu Ya faints in shock. Zhang Yang catches her and tries to calm her down, reassuring her that it’s not definite yet.
02:46~02:54 Qiu Ya, overcome with grief and anger, blames Xia Luo for getting AIDS and demands to be checked for the virus.
02:55~02:59 Yuan Hua, looking distraught, demands to be checked for HIV as well. Zhang Yang looks worried as the scene ends.

00:00~00:06 Coco, a woman in a brown leather jacket, stands in a room with four other people. She asks a woman in a beige suit if the invasion of an agricultural country by two industrialized countries was justified. The woman in the beige suit replies that in the eyes of those industrialized countries, China was a powerful country at that time. A man in a black suit next to Coco agrees, saying that the Qing government considered itself the Celestial Empire.
00:06~00:17 Coco asks the man in the black suit if he is helping her or the woman in the beige suit. He replies that he is helping Coco and asks what she wants to do next.
00:18~00:25 The woman in the beige suit tells the man that on their journey back from China, they encountered a storm and their ship was destroyed. Coco comments that the stolen items were too many and too heavy, calling it retribution.
00:26~00:38 The man asks Coco to repeat herself in English, but she replies that she doesn't speak English. He then translates Coco's words to the woman in the beige suit, saying that Coco thinks it was unfortunate. Coco corrects him, stating that she actually believes the man who stole the items deserved what happened to him.
00:38~00:54 The woman in the beige suit expresses disbelief, pointing out that he was acting on behalf of his country and it was his duty as a soldier. She is relieved that he was rescued by a passing Chinese merchant ship. Coco, however, sarcastically remarks that heaven must have been blind back then.
00:54~01:04 The woman asks Coco to repeat what she said, and the man translates it as "Thank goodness he came back". The woman in the beige suit points out that this was not what Coco said, but thanks the man anyway. He replies "You're welcome".
01:05~01:17 The woman in the beige suit asks Coco what she is doing as Coco picks up a scroll. Coco replies that she is taking it back to China. The woman protests, saying that this is her home and Coco cannot just take anything she wants. Coco argues that just like over a hundred years ago, the woman's ancestors took the painting without asking anyone.
01:18~01:35 The man tries to calm the situation, saying that those events happened a long time ago. He jokes that back then, a woman wearing revealing clothes might get stoned, gesturing towards the woman in the beige suit. He quickly corrects himself, pointing to Coco instead, and apologizes for the mistake.
01:36~01:43 Coco tells the man not to apologize and not to be a pushover, asserting that the ones who should be apologizing are the woman and her ancestors. The woman asks what Coco said, and the man hesitates to translate.
01:44~02:06 Coco states that she doesn't need the man to translate for her. She reminds everyone present that over a hundred years ago, their ancestors came to China and burned, killed, and looted. She emphasizes that even a hundred years later, these events remain a painful memory for the Chinese people.
02:09~02:40 The woman in the beige suit acknowledges the truth of Coco's words, stating that she has studied history. She admits that sometimes these events can only be explained by unreasonable justifications, such as "might makes right". The man adds that they cannot use today's civilized standards to judge the mistakes of the past, pointing out that even now, the strong are the ones who prevail. He concludes that one must possess power before others will listen to reason.
02:40~02:59 The woman in the beige suit tells Coco that she is beginning to understand her perspective. She apologizes to Coco and admits that in the end, all of the items they are arguing about belong to the bank and are worthless to her. She states that she would give them to Coco if she could. The man then turns to Coco, asking if this is what she wanted all along. He points out that it wasn't easy to get to this place and proposes that they stay for two days before leaving. He offers Coco a cup of tea.
02:59~03:00 The woman in the beige suit starts speaking in French.

00:00~00:02 JC and his female teammate are walking with a security guard in a large, multi-level space. The guard suggests they take a look around.
00:02~00:12 The camera pans to show a wide view of the space. The teammate is impressed by the size of the facility, which is a forgery center. JC explains the scale of the operation, noting that they handle tens of billions of transactions each year.
00:12~00:16  The teammate spots a painting and recognizes it as one stolen from a European museum. JC advises her not to underestimate the skilled forgers and points out that they often only gain recognition after death.
00:16~00:24  JC tells the teammate to pay more attention to upstairs. The scene shifts to them observing people working on porcelain items.
00:24~00:28 The teammate asks what the workers are doing. JC explains they use various techniques to age the porcelain, making it appear centuries old.
00:28~00:39 JC then points out a Chinese scroll being worked on. He explains that it is an authentic piece, but because the silk cannot be separated, they are dividing it up to sell in smaller sections.
00:39~00:43 The teammate is impressed by the ingenuity of the forgers. JC directs her attention to workers using x-rays to artificially age new porcelain.
00:43~01:11 The teammate expresses concern about the prevalence of fakes in the market. JC estimates that 90% are counterfeit. The teammate comments on the misfortune of wealthy people who may unknowingly purchase these fakes.
01:11~01:18 The security guard leads them towards another area. JC notices a man with a monkey and recognizes him as an associate of Nine-headed Bird. The teammate questions who the man is, and JC confirms his affiliation.
01:18~01:26 The guard leads them on. JC and his teammate arrive at a large metal contraption emitting steam. The teammate inquires about it.
01:26~01:44 JC explains that the device is used to simulate carbon emissions and is specifically designed to deceive antique experts. He is shocked that they are using such a crude and potentially dangerous method.
01:44~01:49  The teammate comments on the equipment's crude appearance and asks if it is dangerous. JC affirms that all fraudulent practices are risky.
01:49~01:59 Nine-headed Bird appears on a platform above them, lounging on a red couch. He greets JC and asks if he has lost his tongue. JC responds that he doesn't want to see him. 
01:59~02:07 Nine-headed Bird tries to be friendly, but JC is not interested. A woman next to Nine-headed Bird asks who JC is. He introduces JC as a prominent figure in the industry, but the woman suggests that reputations can be misleading.
02:07~02:15 The teammate asks if they are colleagues. JC vehemently denies this, stating that they would never engage in the same practices. Nine-headed Bird, overhearing, mocks JC's self-righteousness.
02:15~02:24 Nine-headed Bird boasts that he can surpass anything JC can do. JC and his teammate walk away, descending a staircase. Nine-headed Bird kicks over a bottle on the railing, shattering it on the floor below.
02:24~02:34 Nine-headed Bird explains to the woman that JC stole a Buddha statue from a Southeast Asian temple. He gloats that people still believe the neighboring country was responsible.
02:34~02:41 JC, overhearing, comments that the theft led to a war that killed thousands. The woman replies callously that people die anyway.
02:41~02:47  Nine-headed Bird dismisses the deaths, claiming it's not his concern. JC angrily calls Nine-headed Bird the "scum" of their profession.
02:47~02:53  Nine-headed Bird, unfazed, mentions that the last person who insulted him is no longer alive. JC smiles mockingly.
02:53~03:00 JC spells out the word "scum" while glaring at Nine-headed Bird.
movie101_6966492004553490981_5340_5520:
00:00~00:02 JC and Nine-headed Bird are sitting on a couch, seemingly arguing.
00:02~00:05 Nine-headed Bird arrogantly claims that he can beat JC without even getting up from the couch. 
00:05~00:11 JC takes a sip of beer, calmly puts down the bottle, and challenges Nine-headed Bird to show him what he's got.
00:11~00:21 Both get up and prepare to fight.
00:21~00:31 They engage in a fight using martial arts techniques.
00:31~00:35 JC knocks down Nine-headed Bird and declares that he has lost. Nine-headed Bird is unwilling to admit defeat and claims that he is still holding on.
00:35~01:19 They continue to fight, showcasing a mix of striking, grappling, and acrobatic maneuvers, utilizing the environment and furniture around them.
01:19~01:44 Despite Nine-headed Bird's persistent attacks, JC gains the upper hand and eventually pins him to the ground.
01:44~01:53 JC stands up, laughing and taunting Nine-headed Bird.  He points to a couch cushion, mockingly saying "touching."
01:53~01:58 Michael, accompanied by his gang, arrives and demands they stop fighting.
01:58~02:04 Michael tells the others that they can leave and enjoy their vacation. The others bid farewell and exit the scene.
02:04~02:09 Bonnie, observing from a lower level, questions what JC and Nine-headed Bird are doing.
02:10~02:18 Michael explains to Bonnie that they were just examining the furniture. JC, unimpressed with the furniture's quality, throws it aside and calls it a cheap imitation. Michael instructs his gang members to take the furniture outside.
02:18~02:25 Nine-headed Bird tries to defend the furniture's authenticity, claiming it is genuine. Bonnie disagrees, calling it a fake. Michael then tells them to settle the matter and move the furniture later.
02:25~02:31 The gang members leave the room.
02:28~02:30 Nine-headed Bird reassures Michael that he will receive his payment tomorrow, as usual.
02:31~02:44 Michael confronts JC about his high asking price for the three students locked upstairs, suggesting they negotiate when his father arrives. JC proposes a discount but insists on having all three students. Michael pretends not to understand.
02:44~02:57 JC insists on proving his point. Michael challenges him to do so.
02:57~03:00 Bonnie looks at Michael with a serious expression, and the scene ends.

1:45~1:57 Bonnie, who is watching from the platform, throws a bottle of water downstairs. The bottle hits one of the men in black suits and he lets go of JC.  Then, JC kicks the wooden boxes and knocks the three attackers down. Bonnie is impressed.

00:25~00:49 The woman in the snakeskin jacket, named Jil,  fights with another woman named Bonnie. Bonnie kicks Jil off the balcony, and then jumps down to continue the fight with Jil.

02:47~02:57 JC is exhausted and breathing heavily. He coughs and then picks up a camera and presses the shutter button. Flash goes off, and he looks surprised.

01:14~01:21 Lawrence, followed by several men in suits, walks through the wreckage and looks around. Michael calls out to him, and Lawrence asks him if he's okay.

Finally, he instructs Michael to disrupt the antique market as revenge.

00:00~00:05 Two men, one in a suit and the other in a patterned jacket, are walking through a dimly lit room. The man in the suit tells someone off-screen to "Let the dragon fly". They enter a brighter room, where a third man in a white shirt sits at a table. The scene cuts to a plane flying over the ocean.
00:05~00:10 Inside the plane, Nine-headed Bird, a skydiver, prepares his parachute and expresses disappointment, saying "What a pity." The scene cuts back to the plane, now flying higher in the sky.
00:10~00:24 A news report plays on a television, discussing protests against the auction of a valuable Chinese dragon head artifact. The report states that the auction house is under pressure and countries worldwide are demanding the return of cultural relics. MP, the company in possession of the dragon head, announces they will take further action if the auction is disrupted. The scene cuts to MP’s representatives, a man in a suit and the other in a patterned jacket, discussing the auction with a smile.
00:24~00:29 The auctioneer starts the private auction for the dragon head.
00:29~00:45 A group of people are watching the live auction on a laptop. The Operator receives a call informing them about a donation of 50 million yuan for the artifact. However, Woman Sitting There explains that the Chinese government wouldn't accept it, as they refuse any artifact bought from auctions. Man Wearing a Jacket suggests they buy it and hold onto it for the government. Woman with a Scarf expresses her disagreement, stating that buying the artifact is a sin. At the auction, the auctioneer announces the second and final call for bids.
00:45~01:23 Another news report shows an active volcano, reporting MP's threat to throw the dragon head into the volcano if no bids are received before noon. The reporter stands with other journalists near the volcano, reporting on the situation. The scene cuts back to the auction, where the auctioneer awaits bids as the deadline approaches. The Journalist reports on the looming deadline, emphasizing the imminent destruction of the dragon head if no action is taken.
01:23~01:36 At the auction, the clock hits noon. The auctioneer announces the item is unsold. The group watching the auction on their laptop celebrates.
01:36~01:43 MP’s representatives receive news that the dragon head is unsold. The man in the suit yells into the phone to "dump it".
01:43~01:55 The scene cuts back to the plane, now flying into a cloudy sky. Three skydivers, including Nine-headed Bird, jump out of the plane. One skydiver carries the dragon head.
01:55~02:08 The scene cuts between the group watching the news report on the skydivers and MP’s representatives, who are observing the unfolding events. The news report confirms that the skydivers have begun their mission. The group becomes concerned as they realize the dragon head is missing. The man in the patterned jacket panics, shouting that they've lost it. MP’s representatives react with amusement, finding humor in the situation. The Foreigner expresses her frustration to an off-screen character about MP corporation's actions.
02:08~02:29 A female news anchor reports on the "Let the Dragon Fly" mission initiated by MP corporation. Three skydivers are seen flying through the clouds. A fourth skydiver suddenly appears, surprising the news crew in a helicopter.
02:29~03:00 The fourth skydiver catches up to the other three. They fight mid-air as one of them tries to snatch the dragon head.

Twelve years ago, there was a theft at the Tokyo Imperial Palace, and someone stole an ancient jade from the Emperor's three sacred treasures. The jade is a red agate. After leaving Japan, he became involved in the underground weapons market. The US suspects he has orchestrated at least three major deals in Asia over the past decade, each time escaping. It is likely that Hong Kong is one of his bases. Song An says, "The adept defender keeps his enemies unaware of their attacks, the adept attacker."

01:18~01:26 Mr. Wu was confused, as hit-and-run cases should be handled by traffic police. President Cheng also questioned which division of the city bureau Zhang Hua was from.

00:22~00:29 Cao Gang and Xing Feng leave the interrogation room. Zhang Hua, left alone, sits silently, contemplating his situation.

01:00~01:22 Kong Laoda is driving a car and talking on the phone to Zhang Hua. He reveals that he killed Zhang Hua's younger brother after kidnapping him and offers to tell him where he is buried for another million.
01:26~01:29 A car arrives at a labor camp. A man enters a building and tells Yu Guohui, who is dressed in a black jacket, that someone is looking for him in the office.
01:29~01:34 Yu Guohui is in the office with Zhang Hua. Zhang Hua reveals he killed Yu's brother and buried him. He then shows Yu Guohui a picture of his brother.
01:36~01:46 Zhang Hua and another man, Cang Zi, enter a room where Mr. Wu is chained to a bed. Zhang Hua tells Mr. Wu that he couldn't find his bank card.
01:46~02:07 Zhang Hua demands Mr. Wu tell him where the card is and searches the room. Mr. Wu insists he doesn't have the card, but Zhang Hua doesn't believe him.
02:07~02:11 Zhang Hua asks Mr. Wu again if he has any more money. Mr. Wu pleads and says he doesn't.
02:11~02:36 Zhang Hua searches Mr. Wu's coat and finds his bank card. He mocks Mr. Wu for being a good actor and asks him if he was a soldier.
02:36~03:00 Mr. Wu confirms he was a soldier and that he used to serve in the south before moving to Hong Kong. Zhang Hua expresses disbelief that a former soldier claims he has never fired a gun.
movie101_6991751088659497479_2160_2340:
00:00~00:03 Zhang Hua and Mr. Wu are in a standoff, Mr. Wu questions Zhang Hua's motives for protecting himself.
00:03~00:16 Zhang Hua grabs Mr. Wu by the neck, questioning his trust. He demands confirmation that the payment on the card is accurate.
00:16~00:20 Mr. Wu, intimidated, confirms the amount is correct. Zhang Hua angrily pushes him back.
00:20~00:27 Zhang Hua demands Mr. Wu to record a video message stating that he is doing well, ensuring his safety while in captivity.
00:27~00:37 Mr. Wu, still chained, struggles to follow Zhang Hua's instructions for the video recording.
00:37~01:09 Zhang Hua reviews the recording and becomes suspicious when he notices a flash. Mr. Wu insists it is recording but eventually takes the camera to review it himself.
01:09~01:13 As Mr. Wu examines the camera, Zhang Hua abruptly attacks him, knocking the camera away.
01:13~01:21 A struggle ensues, Mr. Wu fights back, questioning Zhang Hua's betrayal despite receiving payment. Zhang Hua retorts that smashing the camera won't stop him from recording with his phone.
01:21~01:28 Mr. Wu, chained and desperate, pleads with Zhang Hua about the promise to release him after payment.
01:28~01:53 Zhang Hua, visibly conflicted, justifies his actions, arguing that even in their line of work, integrity matters. He questions whether Zhang Hua's men would respect him if he broke his word.
01:53~02:04 Zhang Hua grapples with his guilt and confesses to promising Mr. Wu's family he would pay the ransom. He admits that he cannot respect Zhang Hua's underhanded tactics.
02:04~02:31 Zhang Hua, after releasing Mr. Wu, walks away, leaving Mr. Wu feeling defeated and betrayed.
02:31~02:40 Mr. Wu asks Zhang Hua how he should address him. Zhang Hua tells him to call him Huazi. Mr. Wu inquires who will retrieve the money from the bank when it opens.
02:40~02:53 Zhang Hua suggests Mr. Wu find a trustworthy friend for the task. Mr. Wu insists he cannot involve his friends in this. Zhang Hua tries to assure Mr. Wu that he understands the rules.

movie101_6991751088659497479_2340_2520:
00:00~00:09 Two plainclothes police officers, Zhang Hua and his partner, enter a pool hall and approach a group of men, including Kong Laoda, a suspect. Zhang Hua informs Kong Laoda that they are the police and there's a case involving him. Kong Laoda, feeling threatened, tells his accomplices that they're not cops and urges them to call the police.
00:09~00:19 A fight breaks out between the police officers and the suspects. Kong Laoda grabs a pool cue to attack Zhang Hua, while other suspects join in the brawl. Kong Laoda instructs someone to call the cops. Zhang Hua attempts to subdue Kong Laoda. A gun falls to the floor amidst the chaos.
00:20~00:35 The suspects, including Kong Laoda and Xiao Lei, flee the pool hall in a black car. Zhang Hua chases after them. Kong Laoda makes a phone call, informing someone about their car's license plate number - 507. He mentions that he and Xing Feng were working on a case nearby with Cao Gang and decided to pursue the suspects together.
00:36~00:46 The chase continues through city streets. Xing Feng's car, also black, follows Kong Laoda's car closely. Kong Laoda's car crashes into a white fence while trying to evade capture.
00:47~01:21 After the crash, Kong Laoda and Xiao Lei flee on foot, running through traffic. Cao Gang and Zhang Hua continue their pursuit. Xiao Lei successfully evades capture, but Kong Laoda is hit by a truck and falls to the ground, allowing Cao Gang to apprehend him.
01:22~01:39 Zhang Hua checks in with Cao Gang via walkie-talkie. Cao Gang reports that he is chasing the suspects, having almost left the city. Urged to move faster, he tells his partner to be quiet and focuses on driving. They follow the suspects' car through a construction site and onto a dirt road, leading to a narrow tunnel under a bridge.
01:40~01:52 As Cao Gang's car enters the tunnel, he receives a warning about a grenade. A grenade explodes, blocking the tunnel entrance with fire and debris. Cao Gang gets out of his car and draws his gun, cautiously approaching the burning wreckage.
01:53~02:16 Back at the police station, Xing Feng briefs Zhang Hua on the situation. He explains that after Zhang Hua escaped, the gang broke up and went into hiding. They managed to track down some of them.  Cao Gang interrogates Qiang Zi, one of the captured suspects, who reveals that someone asked him to lure Kong Laoda out. Cao Gang presses him for the name, and Qiang Zi reluctantly confesses it was his brother, Gang Zi. Police officers raid a hotel room and arrest Gang Zi.
02:17~02:37 Gang Zi is brought in for questioning by Xing Feng. He admits that he was asked by someone named Dongzi to lure Kong Laoda out. When asked about Zhang Hua's whereabouts, Gang Zi claims he doesn't know. Xing Feng reminds Gang Zi to cooperate, and he insists he only knows Dongzi. Xing Feng reveals that Dongzi was a key figure in the gang and they've been searching for him since he split from Zhang Hua.
02:38~03:00 The scene shifts to a dark room. A phone rings, illuminating a glass of water. In a different location, Zhang Hua is lying in bed, bound and gagged. He struggles to reach for a phone on the bedside table. In a rural area, Zhang Hua is sitting in a van with his captors. He manages to secretly call Xing Feng. Xing Feng answers the call, and Zhang Hua whispers that he's been kidnapped.
movie101_6991751088659497479_2520_2700:
00:00~00:07 Mr. Su wakes up in bed to a phone call. He answers the phone and the caller asks where he is. 
00:07~00:20 Mr. Wu, the caller, says he is far away and tells Zhang Hua, who is sitting beside him, not to ask any questions. 
00:20~00:38 Mr. Wu explains to Mr. Su that his kidnapper will call him and ask for money. He tells Mr. Su to withdraw the money and give it to the kidnapper. He also warns Mr. Su to make sure he is still alive before giving the money and not to call the police. 
00:38~00:45 Zhang Hua is confused about Mr. Wu's instructions to Mr. Su not to call the police. He asks what he means by that. 
00:45~00:53 Mr. Wu reassures Zhang Hua by saying not to call the police means not to call the police and tells him to relax.
00:53~01:07 The phone rings again and Mr. Su answers, finding out that it is the kidnapper. He tells Zhang Hua that the kidnapper has called and asks Zhang Hua to come over immediately. 
01:07~01:16 Zhang Hua answers the phone and Mr. Su tells him that Mr. Wu trusts him so he must not harm Mr. Wu.
01:16~01:26 Mr. Wu tells Zhang Hua to call the bank during bank hours to make an appointment for a large withdrawal. 
01:26~01:41 A police officer, who is on the phone, receives information that Zhang Hua is driving a stolen car. Another officer mentions that the scene surveillance points to Bo and that they will develop a plan. 
01:41~02:06 Mr. Wu is chained to Xiao Dou, who is lying on a bed. Mr. Wu laments that he was offered tens of millions to act during the Spring Festival but now his life is worth only a few million. Xiao Dou replies that money is everything. 
02:06~02:29 Mr. Wu tells Xiao Dou that this is the first time he's shared a blanket overnight with a man. Xiao Dou says that he's done it with his brother before and that he knew his life was over when he got kidnapped. Mr. Wu tells him to pretend that he is his brother. 
02:29~02:38 Mr. Wu puts a blanket over Xiao Dou and tells him it's too cold.
02:38~02:56 Police arrive and tell Zhang Hua that they are taking over. Zhang Hua tells Mr. Su that if he is concerned about his safety, they can take his place and meet the kidnappers. Mr. Su says that his relationship with Mr. Wu is not ordinary because they served in the army together and that Mr. Wu called him in this moment because he trusts him like a brother.
02:56~03:00 The officer assures Mr. Su that the kidnappers will contact him again and that they will be here with him waiting.
movie101_6991751088659497479_2700_2880:
00:00~00:06 Xing Feng is comforting Zhang Hua, who seems emotionally distressed. He advises him to be patient and get some sleep.
00:06~00:22 Xing Feng asks if Zhang Hua goes home for New Year. Zhang Hua responds that he can't go home. He misses his mother, but his profession makes it difficult to visit family.
00:22~00:39 Xing Feng inquires about rules in Zhang Hua's line of work. Zhang Hua reveals that money is the ultimate rule; getting the money is all that matters, and taking a life is unnecessary. Xing Feng starts to reminisce about old-time bandits and their ethics, but...
00:39~00:53 Zhang Hua interrupts, stating he doesn't understand ancient history and prefers to focus on the present. Xing Feng shifts the conversation to a contemporary figure in Hong Kong who operates similarly to Zhang Hua.
00:53~01:02 Zhang Hua dismisses the Hong Kong individual, claiming he is insignificant. Xing Feng points out that the person at least adheres to rules in their profession.
01:02~01:07 Zhang Hua challenges Xing Feng, suggesting he fears Zhang Hua might betray him once the ransom is paid. Xing Feng affirms his trust in Zhang Hua.
01:07~01:21 Zhang Hua expresses admiration for Xing Feng's resilience, contrasting him with the cowardly individuals he usually kidnaps. He observes that Xing Feng retained his humanity despite the circumstances.
01:21~01:22 Mr. Wu attributes his strength to his military background.
01:22~01:34 The scene transitions to a night view of an isolated house, followed by a quick shot of a bustling cityscape at night.
01:34~01:54 The text "6 hours after kidnap" appears. Xing Feng checks his phone and receives a text from his wife, reminding him about their son leaving the hospital and his promise to be there. He sighs deeply, seemingly troubled.
01:54~02:12 The scene shifts to a police surveillance room. Cao Gang checks on his colleague, Wei Zi, asking if he slept well.  Cao Gang receives a call updating him on Zhang Hua's movements. He's informed that Zhang Hua left Mr. Wu's place and drove northeast out of the city.
02:12~02:25 Zhang Hua and Mr. Wu are in a room decorated with Chinese New Year posters. Zhang Hua wishes him a Happy New Year and inquires about his age. Mr. Wu reflects and estimates he was around 39 years old at the time depicted in the poster. Zhang Hua compliments Mr. Wu's youthful appearance, who accepts it with a chuckle.
02:25~02:40 Zhang Hua comments on the disparity of fate, with some living comfortably and others struggling. Mr. Wu advises him to take responsibility for his own choices rather than blaming others. He admits to being selfish himself, prompting Zhang Hua to ask about his supposed problems.
02:40~02:53 Mr. Wu insists he has no problems, leading Zhang Hua to recount his nine years of imprisonment. He emphasizes the arduous duration and his hard-won freedom. Mr. Wu urges him to find a proper occupation now that he's out. Zhang Hua questions the definition of "proper," sarcastically asking what that entails.
02:53~03:00 Mr. Wu suggests finding a job or pursuing acting.  The video ends with Zhang Hua staring intensely.

00:40~00:51 Xing Feng shoots at Dong Zi as he tries to climb over a metal fence. He misses, but Dong Zi falls and injures himself. Cao Gang arrives at the scene, pulls out his gun, and secures Dong Zi.

01:08~01:24 Cao Gang and Li Jiehui are walking and discussing the case. They learned from Dong Zi that Hua Zi wants them to kill Zhang Hua, the kidnap victim, so that there will be no witnesses left. They also learned that Zhang Hua told Dong Zi he was renting a farmhouse in the suburbs next to an orchard.

01:32~01:40 Mr. Wu, Zhang Hua, and Xiao Dou are tied up in a room.  Xiao Dou suggests calling Hua Zi to see what he wants, but Mr. Wu points out that Hua Zi changes his SIM card every time he calls, so no one knows his number.

Several police officers arrive at the street where the silver car is parked.

movie101_6991751088659497479_4320_4500:
00:00~00:07 Zhang Hua and other members of his gang hold a man hostage at night. One gang member points a grenade at the hostage while another gang member pins him to the ground. After successfully securing the hostage, they receive confirmation from their accomplices via walkie-talkie.
00:07~00:17 The scene transitions to 18 hours after the kidnapping. Manager Zhang, a senior police officer, receives updates on the situation. He is informed that the hostage has been apprehended and had two guns and a grenade. Manager Zhang instructs the team to bring the hostage to him. The hostage, who has visible injuries on his face, is taken out of a police car and brought inside a building.
00:17~00:46 Police officers escort Zhang Hua inside the building. They bring him to a small room and order him to stand straight against the wall. Xing Feng, another police officer, interrogates Zhang Hua and asks him if he is ready to talk now.

01:05~01:49 Zhang Hua tries to bargain with the police. He proposes that they allow him to call his gang members and order them to evacuate. Then, he would lead the police to Wu's location. When asked where his gang members would go, Zhang Hua claims he wouldn't be responsible for their whereabouts.
01:49~02:09 Frustrated with Zhang Hua's attitude, Xing Feng tightens his handcuffs. Zhang Hua complains about the police's aggressive behavior and demands to speak to the officer who arrested him. However, the police ignore his request.  At that moment, someone knocks on the door, pretending to be from the property management, reporting a water leak downstairs. The police officers use this opportunity to slip away from the room. 
02:09~02:18 Police officers rappel down the building and enter an apartment through the window. Inside, they discover a woman named Chen Chen. They order her to kneel down and embrace her head. 
02:18~02:24 Xing Feng makes a phone call and orders someone to return quickly. He then briefs Manager Zhang on the situation, informing him that Chen Chen is most likely Zhang Hua's new girlfriend.  It's revealed that Chen Chen is not feeling well and Liu Yun took her to the hospital.
02:24~02:38 Manager Zhang unlocks Zhang Hua's handcuffs from the tiger bench.
02:38~03:00 Manager Zhang taunts Zhang Hua, asking if he wants to try his luck one last time. Zhang Hua expresses surprise that Manager Zhang didn't suspect him of being a criminal earlier. Cao Gang orders Zhang Hua to get to the point and reveal the hostage's location. However, Zhang Hua evades the question, stating that he didn't expect Manager Zhang to be a better actor than him. Cao Gang again demands the hostage's location, but the scene ends before Zhang Hua answers.

Xiao Xing, overwhelmed by the chaos, stands still with a worried look.

00:00~00:16 Officer Lu is talking to Lu Xiaoxing, a blind woman, about his appearance and how people used to think he looked older than his age. He mentions that people could tell by his voice. He then mentions that some people are "heart blind" and Lu Xiaoxing agrees with him.
00:16~00:28 Lu Xiaoxing explains to Officer Lu that she can determine a person's height by their voice pitch and their build by the weight of their steps. She then uses the example of Officer Lu and the young policeman eating chive dumplings that morning.
00:28~00:33 Officer Lu is surprised to learn that Lu Xiaoxing knew about their breakfast and coughs to cover his embarrassment. Lu Xiaoxing suggests they continue the discussion.
00:34~00:45 Officer Lu agrees to continue and asks Lu Xiaoxing about the driver who she said hit a dog. Lu Xiaoxing explains that she got into a taxi at around 9 p.m. and heard a rolling sound and the taxi's top light breaking after driving for 10 minutes. She deduces that the driver must have been lying about hitting a dog based on the sound. 
00:45~01:12 Lu Xiaoxing further deduces that the driver must have been left-handed as he wore his watch on his right wrist, which is not common for right-handed people. 
01:14~01:23 Officer Lu asks how the accident happened, and Lu Xiaoxing explains that the driver insisted on opening her coffee bottle for her, even though she could do it herself.
01:23~01:35 Officer Lu seems troubled by this information. He suggests they end the discussion for the day and thanks Lu Xiaoxing for her cooperation. He then asks Lu Xiaoxing how she knew about his bad leg.
01:35~01:54 Lu Xiaoxing explains that she could tell his leg was bad because his steps were uneven and the strong smell of musk pain relief plaster. Officer Lu laughs awkwardly and denies having any problems.

00:10~00:17 Lu Li contemplates the remark while Young Policeman returns to his work on the laptop. Lu Li then receives a phone call.

00:25~00:28 Lu Li, in a frustrated tone, reiterates to the caller that the vehicle was not a taxi. He appears annoyed and exasperated.

00:38~00:47 Lin Chong teases Xiao Xing about her vision, asking if she is blind. Lu Li scolds him for his rude behavior. 
00:47~00:52 Lu Li, turning to Xiao Xing, seeks her confirmation about the type of car involved in the incident.
00:52~01:07 Lin Chong confidently asserts that the car was a 2010 Golf 6, using exaggerated language to emphasize his certainty and challenges anyone to contradict him.
01:08~01:16 Xiao Xing steps in, addressing Lu Li as Officer. She explains that although blind, she possesses keen hearing and judgment skills. She heard the taxi meter's sound when she got into the vehicle, leading her to believe it was a taxi. 
01:17~01:29 Lin Chong sarcastically advises Xiao Xing to listen attentively and make a judgment based on her hearing. He mockingly asks her to confirm his gender, further displaying his disrespectful attitude. 
01:29~01:45 Xiao Xing ignores Lin Chong's comment and notices his phone, remarking that it's the same model as hers. Lin Chong questions who would buy her such a complicated device and challenges her ability to use all its features.

02:14~02:22 Lu Li asks about the license plate number. Lin Chong evades the question, arguing that it was too dark and rainy to see clearly.

02:28~02:48 Lin Chong admits to seeing the hit-and-run and explains he assumed the driver was taking the victim to the hospital. Xiao Xing reveals that she was in the back seat and witnessed the driver dragging the victim into the trunk, exposing Lin Chong’s fabrication.
02:49~02:52 Lu Li angrily accuses Lin Chong of trying to scam the reward money and criticizes his foul language.

01:30~01:44 The scene transitions to a ruined house in the woods. The camera focuses on a door with a red scarf hanging on it. Zhang Xiantu's voiceover describes the place as a former "comfort station" and points out that it was secured by barbed wire and trenches.
01:44~02:22 Zhang Xiantu's voiceover continues, explaining the layout of the former comfort station. Two cave dwellings at the front used to imprison Liu Mianhuan and Feng Zhuangxiang. Three cave dwellings on the east side were used to imprison Li Xiumei and Zhang Xiaoni.
02:22~02:38 Zhang Xiantu's voiceover mentions four rooms on the south side where Hou Dong'e and Chen Lintao were held. She describes two brick beds in a cave dwelling, likely accommodating women. 
02:38~02:48  Zhang Xiantu's voiceover estimates that based on her research, at least over 40 women were imprisoned in this courtyard. 
02:48~02:59  Zhang Xiantu's voiceover lists several stronghold locations: Shangshe stronghold, Xiyan sawmill stronghold, and Hedong stronghold. She emphasizes that through her investigation, she discovered victimized women wherever the Japanese occupied.

00:00~00:10 Yinmei Mao, an elderly woman, is recalling a difficult time in her life. She explains that she was born in South Korea and that her family had to flee because they had no food to eat.
00:15~00:34 Yinmei Mao continues, explaining that her mother abandoned her and her younger sister, leaving them with her grandmother (Gaga). Yinmei Mao expresses her sadness and longing for her mother, emphasizing that she was always missing her.
00:34~00:56 Yinmei Mao clarifies that her Gaga is actually her mother-in-law. She expresses her gratitude towards her Gaga, stating that she looked for her everywhere and without her, she would have been lost.
00:56~01:10 Yinmei Mao describes the moment she fled with her mother, unsure of her age at the time. She reiterates her lack of awareness regarding her age when they had to leave.
01:12~01:27 Yinmei Mao reveals that she only knew the woman who abandoned her as her mother. She recalls a moment where they looked at each other, the mother helpless and without a father for support.
01:28~01:49 Yinmei Mao recounts her mother's return to South Korea by train, leaving from a high place.
01:50~02:07 Yinmei Mao vividly remembers crying as the train departed, with people above looking down and throwing food for them. She picked up the food and ate, while her mother cried.
02:07~02:14 Yinmei Mao, still unaware of the situation's complexity, shares that she would eat voraciously whenever food was available.
02:19~02:36 Yinmei Mao describes being tricked by Koreans who promised work at a Japanese sock factory in Hankou, possibly in July.
02:36~02:45 Yinmei Mao recalls being taken to the location where the Japanese were staying and being locked up with both Koreans and Japanese.
02:45~03:00 Yinmei Mao paints a picture of a place with numerous doors, all locked, trapping them inside. She remembers everyone standing against the wall, facing the entrance, which was guarded.

00:06~00:16 She recounts how people were taken away one by one to be "played with" and then released, emphasizing that nothing was done to her.
00:16~00:24 She remembers that the Japanese soldiers didn't care about them, didn't even look at them, and states that she remembers some things but not others.
00:24~00:42  Grandma reiterates that she remembers some things and forgets others, gets emotional, expresses unwillingness to talk about it further, and falls silent, wiping away tears with her hands.

She mentions that her mother never told her anything about the past and said there was no need to talk about it now that she is old. She respects her mother's wishes and doesn't press her for details.
01:27~01:34 Huang Meirong reiterates that there is nothing to say about the past and it is inappropriate for them as the younger generation to speak up about her mother's experiences.

Huang Meirong states her father, who passed away 18 years ago, must have known about it but never spoke about it.
02:12~02:27 The scene transitions to Huang Meirong having dinner with her family, including Grandma.  They eat in silence.

00:02~00:07 Xiao Bao asks Ye Hong how she knew "he" would call. Ye Hong asks back how he knew "he" wouldn’t.
00:07~00:13  Xiao Bao receives a text message and shows it to Ye Hong, who turns her head and smiles. Then Zhang Dan walks over to them, looking at his phone.
00:14~00:23 Zhang Dan picks up the phone and dials. Ye Hong says hello. Zhang Dan greets Ye Hong, who is lying on the sofa, calling her Rose and introducing himself as Charlie. Ye Hong asks what's up.
00:24~00:33 Xiao Bao proposes to Ye Hong to schedule an exclusive interview, Ye Hong says she is not available tomorrow, Xiao Bao says how about the day after tomorrow. 
00:34~00:41 Xiao Bao says let's talk in his office the day after tomorrow, and asks for Ye Hong's confirmation. Ye Hong agrees and smiles.
00:42~00:45 Ye Hong asks Xiao Bao to send her the address. Xiao Bao says he'll send a driver to pick her up.
00:46~00:52 Ye Hong hangs up the phone. Xiao Bao asks why she hung up the phone and if there is anything else. Ye Hong sits up, starts to remove the mask and says Xiao Bao is annoying.
00:53~00:59 Xiao Bao is surprised and asks Ye Hong where she is going. Ye Hong says she's going to check the effect of her mask. Xiao Bao excitedly says that the call actually came through.
01:00~01:05 Ye Hong goes into a room and tells Xiao Bao to answer the phone. Xiao Bao picks up the phone with an excited expression and asks Zhang Dan if he just saw that.
01:06~01:23 A black car is driving on a winding road. The car arrives at a hill and continues driving along the foot of the hill. As the car moves, a castle is gradually revealed on the top of the hill. The car then drives into a forest and stops.
01:24~01:33 The car stops on a grassy slope, Pierre gets out of the car, and Amber also gets out of the car and stands behind Pierre.
01:34~02:02 Pierre takes out two glass balls and rolls them in his hands. Amber asks him to stop. Pierre apologizes to Amber and says it's his way of relieving stress and the doctor's order. Amber doubts if it works. Pierre shakes his head and says not really, then puts away the glass balls.
02:03~02:17 Pierre looks up at the castle on the hill with a heavy expression and takes out a pair of binoculars. Amber notices Pierre’s reaction and walks over to him. 
02:18~02:26 Amber asks Pierre why he is so intent on catching Zhang Dan. Pierre says he is just curious. Pierre tells Amber that he is sorry if he made her uncomfortable earlier.
02:27~02:39 Pierre tells Amber that when Zhang Dan stole the "Eye of Forest", he chased him through the streets of Paris and almost caught him.
02:40~02:49 A flashback shows a white police car upside down in the street, engulfed in flames. Pierre is trapped in the car, thinking he's going to die for sure. His face is covered in blood, and he looks desperate.
02:50~03:00 Zhang Dan appears, crouches down and looks at Pierre in the burning wreckage. He shows a cold smile, then leaves without hesitation.
movie101_7026623602615452196_2880_3060:
00:00~00:07 A man in a police car is struggling to get out. The car has flipped and the man is trapped inside.
00:07~00:11 The car is upside down on the street and the man is trying to get out. He is yelling and scared.
00:11~00:18 The car explodes. A man who appears to be a motorcyclist approaches the car and finds a small metal ball.
00:18~00:37 The motorcyclist kicks the metal ball away, then walks to his motorcycle and drives away. Several police cars come to the scene.
00:37~00:53 Two men lie on the ground, hurt by the explosion. Another man approaches and stares at them with an angry expression.
00:53~01:18 The angry man tells a woman standing next to him that he wants to catch the thief. The scene cuts to a man looking through binoculars, and a woman standing next to him in a park.
01:18~01:32 Through the binoculars, the man and woman see a car stop and a woman in black get out. The man holding the binoculars confirms the identity of the woman in black.
01:32~01:36 The woman in the park asks what they will do, and the man responds they will follow the woman in black.
01:36~02:03 The scene cuts to a digital reconstruction of a castle, and a man in a black suit walking towards the castle.
02:03~02:12 The woman in black arrives at the castle, and a man leads her inside. 
02:12~02:18 The scene cuts to a different man, Zhang Dan, and his companion Xiao Bao, who are watching surveillance footage of the castle from a room.
02:18~02:24 The scene cuts to a servant preparing tea in a room in the castle as Ye Hong enters and sits down. 
02:24~02:27 Ye Hong takes a voice recorder out of her bag and asks Zhang Dan if she can record their conversation. Zhang Dan allows her to record.
02:27~02:34 Zhang Dan enters the room. Ye Hong welcomes him and tells him they can start the interview now.
02:34~02:38 Ye Hong asks Zhang Dan when he was born.
02:38~02:46 Zhang Dan tells her his birth year and says he’s holding a birthday party on the 31st of this month, and he wants to invite her.
02:46~02:52 Ye Hong says maybe, and suggests finishing the interview first. Then she asks him how old was he when he first started drinking.
02:52~02:59 Zhang Dan says sixteen. Ye Hong asks him what kind of wine it was. Zhang Dan says he doesn't remember, but it was definitely an expensive one.
02:59~03:00 Ye Hong questions if any expensive wine is good.
movie101_7026623602615452196_3060_3240:
00:00~00:04 Charlie and Ye Hong are discussing his philosophies about money and everything.
00:04~00:14 Ye Hong is interviewing Charlie about his job
00:15~00:26 Charlie explains that his job is making money, both big and small. He gives an example of how he makes money from his castle. Ye Hong asks about his most valuable antique.
00:27~00:36 Charlie asks Ye Hong if she’s heard of the "Spring of Spirits"
00:37~00:50 Ye Hong's friend is surprised when Charlie mentions the "Spring of Spirits" and Ye Hong proposes taking a picture of Charlie with the "Spring of Spirits" to make their interview more interesting.
00:51~01:07 Charlie agrees and leads Ye Hong and her friend to the "Spring of Spirits" through a secret passage. Ye Hong's friend is amazed by the secret passage, commenting on how it's a "must-have for the rich."
01:08~01:27 They arrive at a vault. Ye Hong asks about the security system and Charlie explains how it's connected to his phone. He shows Ye Hong his collection of artifacts and leads them to the "Spring of Spirits." 
01:28~01:47 Charlie tells Ye Hong that the "Spring of Spirits" is his favorite piece and explains that it's very valuable, which is why it's kept in a secure vault. 
01:48~02:09 Charlie introduces Ye Hong to his security dog, Buddy (Animal). Ye Hong says that she's met Buddy (Animal) before and Charlie encourages her to call the dog. Buddy (Animal) responds to Ye Hong's call. 
02:10~02:36 Ye Hong suggests that they start taking pictures. Charlie agrees and positions himself next to the "Spring of Spirits" after Ye Hong complains about the glare from the glass display case. Charlie opens the display case using a high-tech security system. 
02:37~02:50 Ye Hong is impressed by the high-tech security system. She takes some pictures of Charlie and suggests taking another.
02:51~03:00 Charlie adjusts his hair and poses for another photo. Ye Hong suggests that he try a more "homely" pose.

00:03~00:19 In another dimly lit room filled with artifacts, Ye Hong, a woman in a black dress and glasses, is directing Charlie for a photoshoot with a professional camera. She asks him to move left and stand higher while instructing him to pose with a sense of loftiness. 
00:20~00:39 Back in the first room, Ye Hong continues to instruct Charlie on his pose. She repeatedly asks him to move to the left to get the perfect angle. 
00:40~00:45 Ye Hong adjusts the camera settings, smiles, and starts filming.
00:46~01:01 Scene changes to two men, Zhang Dan and his companion, watching a video on a laptop. A woman in a yellow dress and grey blazer, possibly a tour guide, is leading a tour group outside a castle while explaining that during World War II, the Nazis occupied the castle and built a secret passage leading to a wine cellar. 
01:02~01:21 The scene cuts to Pierre, a middle-aged man with a beard, wearing a dark jacket, standing by a black car in a wooded area. He raises binoculars to observe two people walking towards a castle gate. As a group of tourists exits the castle, Pierre follows them, hiding his face and trying to blend in. 
01:22~01:37 Amber, wearing a black dress, walks out of the castle, accompanied by a man in a suit, possibly a security guard. Pierre, now inside the castle, spots Amber and follows her through the dispersing crowd.
01:38~01:56  At a shooting range, Pierre practices shooting. After finishing, he removes his ear protection, takes a gun, reloads it, and keeps it by his side. 
01:57~02:46 Zhang Dan surprises Pierre at the shooting range, approaching him from behind while aiming a gun at him. Pierre turns around, also pointing his gun at Zhang Dan. Zhang Dan comments that Pierre hasn’t learned his lesson from his time in prison. Pierre retorts that he has tried to reform himself by taking art classes, but he is simply better at stealing art than making it.  Zhang Dan argues that this proves he’s still a thief. He lowers his voice and tells Pierre he wouldn’t be there if he didn’t want to talk. 
02:47~02:54 A man working at the shooting range questions what is happening, interrupting the confrontation. Zhang Dan pushes Pierre aside and leaves.
02:55~03:00 The scene cuts to Pierre sitting at a table in a cafe with a woman, possibly Amber. Another woman walks up to them, hands them a menu, and leaves. Pierre watches Zhang Dan walk past the cafe, and the woman with him says that Zhang Dan still cares about him.
movie101_7026623602615452196_3420_3600:
00:00~00:09 Amber, sitting across from Pierre (elderly) in a cafe, asks him who betrayed him. She mentions he mentioned knowing the feeling of being betrayed before.
00:09~00:39 Pierre (elderly), looking solemn, tells a story about his father, whom he admired when he was young. His father, who was loved and respected by everyone, used to travel a lot for work and bring Pierre (elderly) gifts, promising to take him along when he was older.
00:39~00:57  He then describes the day when he was 14 and the police raided their house, seizing everything and arresting his father. He says he doesn't know if the gifts his father gave him were stolen, and that it doesn't matter anymore. His father died in prison, leaving them with nothing.
00:57~01:23 A flashback shows a young Pierre (youth) watching from the window as police officers escort his father into a police car.
01:23~01:48  Amber asks Pierre (elderly) if he ever confronted his father. He replies that his father died in prison and that people like his father and Zhang destroy lives, stealing not just objects but also trust. He then asks her why she agreed to help him.
01:48~02:30  Amber explains that she took the opportunity to help because it was the right thing to do, but she hadn't realised how hard it would be. She says that although she hates Zhang, she still... Pierre (elderly) interrupts her, telling her not to say any more and that he understands. 
02:30~02:43 Pierre (elderly) opens a red invitation that reveals Charlie is throwing a birthday party at his castle. He states he must go.
02:43~02:48 Amber, looking determined, says she's going with him and that she wants to go. The scene then cuts to a white warehouse.
02:48~02:57 Amber arrives at a large, dimly lit warehouse. She walks up a metal staircase and looks around, spotting a man working on a vehicle.
02:57~03:00 Amber calls out to the man, looking around the warehouse and asking what kind of fingerprint scanner he has.
movie101_7026623602615452196_3600_3780:
00:00~00:05 Ye Hong is having trouble strapping on a device. She asks Xiao Bao for help and tells him to hurry up.
00:05~00:24 Ye Hong is standing, and Xiao Bao is kneeling and helping her strap on a device that looks like a bomb.
00:24~00:46 Xiao Bao tells Ye Hong that the mission is dangerous and that if anything happens, neither of them should attempt to rescue the other. He says that is the rule set by Zhang Dan. Ye Hong seems dissatisfied with the rule.
00:46~01:09 Xiao Bao adjusts the device he strapped on Ye Hong. Ye Hong is unhappy that it's too tight and says she can't breathe, but Xiao Bao says to give it a try.
01:09~01:14 Ye Hong tries on the device, and Xiao Bao places his hand on her waist to comfort her.
01:14~01:25 Xiao Bao takes Ye Hong to a computer and asks her to scan her fingerprints. He hugs her from behind and holds her hand tightly, asking her to press harder, and the two stare at each other affectionately. The computer shows that the fingerprint scan is successful.
01:25~01:40 Xiao Bao puts on his jacket and goes to a white castle model. Ye Hong follows.
01:40~01:56 Ye Hong asks about the red marks on the castle model, and Xiao Bao explains that they are surveillance cameras covering a 50-meter radius around the castle, making it hard to enter from ground level.
01:56~02:09 Ye Hong asks how they will get in. Zhang Dan walks over and explains that they will enter through the winery next to the castle. He then points to a model truck.
02:09~02:18 The camera shows a truck driving on a dirt road and then cuts to the inside of the truck, where Xiao Bao and Zhang Dan are hiding in wine barrels. Xiao Bao is worried they might suffocate.
02:18~02:27 The truck arrives at the castle. A truck driver, Lao Mo, is seen handing some documents to a guard.
02:27~02:38 The scene transitions to a basement where Lao Mo is pushing a wine barrel. Zhang Dan says Lao Mo will get them in by using the excuse of replacing wine barrels. Lao Mo looks at the camera with a sly smile.
02:38~03:00 Back in the warehouse, Zhang Dan points to the model and explains there is a tunnel inside the winery leading to the security control center underneath the castle. He assigns Xiao Bao to take out the guards. Xiao Bao gives a determined nod.

00:27~00:33  Xiao Bao asks what's going on and learns from his partner that a Big Black Dog has attacked the spider robot, damaging it.
00:34~00:39  Zhang Dan urges Xiao Bao to find a solution quickly as they are running out of time. The Big Black Dog chews on the spider robot.

She tells Zhang Dan that she used to be like him, trusting and looking up to their boss like a father. 00:53~01:08 Yurik, now intrigued, urges Zhang Dan to continue. Zhang Dan tells the story of how he helped King Kong steal an artifact called the 'Eye of the Forest', but was ambushed by a young Eastern European thief who stole it from him. The thief was later killed by King Kong.
01:09~01:19 King Kong dismisses the story, but Zhang Dan reveals a shocking twist: the Eastern European thief was actually Zhang Dan's younger brother. He questions King Kong if he would have still come if he had known the truth.
01:20~01:23 Yurik, stunned by the revelation, asks Zhang Dan how he knows all this.

01:45~01:52 Zhang Dan asserts that King Kong is the one truly breaking the rules by setting up the ambush and killing both his brother and the thief. Ye Hong, who has been silently observing the tense exchange, suddenly draws her gun and aims it at King Kong.
01:53~02:02 The camera focuses on Ye Hong's determined face as she holds King Kong at gunpoint. Recovering from the shock, she confronts King Kong, accusing him of shooting at her. King Kong, realizing the situation has turned against him, feebly tries to defend himself.

The scene cuts to a flashback of Yurik's betrayal, showing him hiring a young Eastern European boy and retrieving the 'Eye of the Forest' from the boy's dead body. The flashback reveals the same tattoo on the boy's tongue as the one on Yurik's neck.

Zhang Dan, still holding the gun to King Kong's head, taunts him, asking what he's afraid of. King Kong, realizing his imminent demise, urges Zhang Dan to shoot.
02:46~03:00 The scene ends with Zhang Dan pulling back the hammer of the gun, leaving the fate of King Kong ambiguous. The robot spider, activated, scurries away into the shadows, hinting at its future role in the story.

00:00~00:01 A middle-aged male doctor wearing glasses talks to a young woman with short hair, Qi Jia, in his office.
00:01~00:13 The doctor says that the age of menopausal patients is decreasing and prescribes Qi Jia a 'Dingkun Dan'. He tells her about Emperor Qianlong, who had three thousand concubines who maintained their youth thanks to 'Dingkun Dan'. 
00:14~00:34 Qi Jia stands up, indignant, and tells the doctor he misdiagnosed her. She says she's not dizzy, not married, and hasn't had a child yet, and her mom hasn't even hit menopause yet. 
00:34~00:44 The doctor tells her she is angry and a little dizzy, typical symptoms of menopause. He compares her to a cactus, prickly on the outside but soft on the inside.
00:44~00:46 Annoyed, Qi Jia pricks the doctor's chin with the cactus.
00:47~00:55 The scene shifts to Qi Jia lying on the grass in a park, wearing a pink blouse and a red skirt. A woman in a green dress, Lin Shuer, walks over to her.
00:56~01:18 Lin Shuer crouches beside Qi Jia and asks her if she has hit menopause. Qi Jia sits up, visibly annoyed. Lin Shuer says she told Qi Jia before that not getting her period for six months is a bad omen. She questions Qi Jia about why she pricked the doctor's chin with a cactus. Qi Jia says she did what she did and asks why Lin Shuer gave her number to the doctor. Lin Shuer stands up and tells her to get in the car.
01:19~01:22 Lin Shuer opens the car door for Qi Jia and asks what she wants to do tonight.

01:31~01:46 Qi Jia talks about how graduating students always turn the quiet summer night into a wild one. She reminisces about getting drunk and crying about her lost love during graduation. She feels nostalgic about the time and complains about her wedding dress costing five hundred yuan to rent. 
01:47~01:55 Lin Shuer tells Qi Jia to not be down and reminds her about getting her dress dirty. Qi Jia says it can’t get dirty. She complains about having a stomachache and asks why her heart isn’t aching instead. Lin Shuer says she deserves it.

00:13~00:26 Qi Jia dismisses his concern, claiming it's just premature aging and nothing serious.  She assures him there's no need to worry and if she's sick she will take medicine. Yuan Xiaoou, looking solemn and concerned, says he will cure her.
00:27~00:36 Qi Jia picks up the photo from the floor and looks at it with a sad and regretful expression. Tears well up in her eyes, and she leans against the door, overcome with emotion.

The Doctor explains that the fast-paced, stressful life can cause premature aging in some women, just like Qi Jia, who is experiencing panic, irritation, hypersensitivity, violent tendencies, agitation and slack skin.

01:44~01:49 Lin Shuer, losing her patience, urges the Doctor to prescribe medication for Qi Jia instead of stating the obvious. The Doctor responds that medication is part of the solution, but it also requires lifestyle changes.
01:50~02:15 The doctor emphasizes the importance of exercise and romance, suggesting that Yuan Xiaoou could physically assist Qi Jia in completing her tasks.  Yuan Xiaoou becomes agitated and the Doctor chides him for being incapable and avoiding the topic.
02:16~02:20 Lin Shuer, visibly upset by Yuan Xiaoou’s behavior, grabs a small potted cactus and demands that they leave. Yuan Xiaoou reluctantly follows her.
02:21~02:35 Lin Shuer apologizes to the Doctor as they leave, calling Yuan Xiaoou neurotic.  The Doctor, left alone, looks at the cactus they left behind, mutters “Next!” and then throws it in the trash can with a disgusted look.

02:43~02:51 Yuan Xiaoou, unconcerned, suggests following the Doctor's advice of medication and exercise. Lin Shuer criticizes him for his nonchalant attitude and advises him to help Qi Jia personally.

00:00~00:02 Mr. Xu and Driver stand at the reception desk of a company called "Horse Door-Ass Search Limited Company," wanting to meet Boss Bao.
00:02~00:04 Driver asks Receptionist if he should register alone.

00:06~00:08 Mr. Xu reminds Receptionist that it was Boss Bao who called him.
00:08~00:12 Receptionist insists on the company policy and asks them to register.
00:12~00:16 Mr. Xu and Driver walk into the office, but are stopped by another staff member because they haven't registered.
00:16~00:26 Wu Jiang, Boss Bao's assistant, introduces himself, mentioning that Boss Bao is busy.
00:27~00:32 Wu Jiang offers Mr. Xu and Driver tea and asks about the situation. Mr. Xu explains he is the person who lost the box.
00:32~00:38 Wu Jiang asks them to relax and offers them tea while he explains the company's history.
00:38~01:19 Wu Jiang gives a brief history of the "finding industry," relating it to the Warring States period when nobles lost valuables while fleeing wars.
01:20~01:23 Mr. Xu, growing impatient, asks Wu Jiang if his box has been found.
01:23~01:42 Wu Jiang assures Mr. Xu that the box will be found and, noting his impatience, skips the rest of his company introduction to focus on the present situation.
01:42~01:51 Mr. Xu, still unsatisfied with the vague answer, asks to speak directly with Boss Bao.
01:51~01:59 Wu Jiang hesitates as Boss Bao appears and asks who Mr. Xu is.
01:59~02:04 Mr. Xu addresses Boss Bao directly, asking if his box has been found.
02:04~02:11 Boss Bao asks Mr. Xu and Driver where they are from. Mr. Xu replies, "Central Plains."
02:11~02:20 Driver clarifies they are from Henan, and Boss Bao jokingly insists Henan and Central Plains are the same.
02:20~02:28 Driver asks Boss Bao where he is from, but he avoids the question and promises to explain the situation properly.
02:28~02:34 Boss Bao explains that while they haven't found the box yet, he is confident they will.
02:34~02:55 He explains that they initially used American satellite positioning but it was only good for finding oil. They have switched to a German system, which is better suited for finding boxes.
02:55~03:00 Mr. Xu asks how far along the search is, and Boss Bao reveals they are searching within a 100-kilometer radius.

00:00~00:08 Base Man, in a high-tech control room, briefs Mr. Xu and Plaid Shirt Man on the situation, explaining that numerous people carrying different colored boxes are on the move. He requests detailed information about their specific box.
00:08~00:16 Mr. Xu states his box is a 2.5-inch Lion brand. Base Man then contacts 01, an agent on the ground, for an update.
00:16~00:32 01 reports a large group of people boarding a northbound train but no suspicious individuals are identified. Base Man orders the search area expanded, including airports, docks, and stations, even scrutinizing foreign individuals.
00:32~00:47 Base Man contacts agent 02, commenting on her light attire before requesting a target update. 02 reports a dark-colored vehicle moving west to east on Highway 502 with a silver box in the trunk.
00:47~00:58 Mr. Xu urgently demands the vehicle be intercepted. Base Man tries to calm the situation, instructing 02 to maintain target lock and report any changes.
01:00~01:11 Base Man expresses frustration at needing to rely on traditional police methods in China, as opposed to more direct action in Mexico. Mr. Xu, eager for a solution, asks about the cost.
01:11~01:33 Base Man clarifies their services are free, positioning themselves as an international NGO offering charitable assistance. He dismisses Plaid Shirt Man's confusion about free satellite usage.
01:33~02:05 Base Man makes a phone call, confirming the box's location and assuring it will be delivered within two hours. Mr. Xu and Plaid Shirt Man express astonishment at the rapid progress.
02:05~02:14 Base Man reveals a requirement for Mr. Xu to provide proof of public service activities as per the organization's rules. Confused, Mr. Xu asks for clarification on what qualifies.
02:14~02:24 Base Man provides examples like blood donation, charitable contributions, or community service, emphasizing that only one example is needed to qualify for their free service.
02:24~02:43 Plaid Shirt Man eagerly volunteers his extensive public service record, only to be cut off by Base Man who clarifies he was addressing Mr. Xu. Plaid Shirt Man insists his record applies, highlighting their brotherhood.
02:43~02:58 Mr. Xu tries to excuse himself due to work commitments, but Base Man presses him, urging him to recall any instance of helping others, even something as small as handing found money to the police. Plaid Shirt Man again interjects, claiming those acts were actually his own.
02:58~03:00 Base Man, seemingly amused, expresses his apologies. The scene ends with all three characters staring intently at each other, the tension hanging in the air.

00:48~00:57 Da Zang confirms Yan Zhu's statements and reveals that his master told him he met his father in the Central Plains.

01:26~01:35 Yan Zhu points out that the eagle tattoo on Da Zang’s back is the same as Huo Feiteng’s. She then asks how his master brought him to Penglai. Da Zang replies he doesn’t know.
01:35~01:47 Yan Zhu reveals to Da Zang that he is their child - the child of her and Huo Feiteng.
01:48~01:59 Da Zang, shocked, denies the revelation, stating that it would mean his master is his father's killer, Baoyu is his brother, and Yan Zhu is his mother.

02:41~02:47 Bai Sankong asks Mulang Shenjun if he would like to hear him play a piece on the zither.

00:00~00:02 Supervisor, a man with long black hair, claims he is just there for the fun.

01:22~01:32 The Supervisor warns Bai Sankong to be careful and says that it would be a pity if the Guqin was destroyed. Bai Sankong confidently responds that it won’t come to that.
01:32~01:39 Bai Sankong moves to strum the strings of the Guqin. The Supervisor, sensing something is wrong, immediately grabs Bai Sankong's hand. Bai Sankong attacks the Supervisor.
01:39~02:13 The two men fight, using the Guqin as a weapon. The Supervisor uses the Guqin to defend himself, blocking Bai Sankong's attacks. Eventually, Bai Sankong kicks the Guqin away and escapes to a different area, standing on the roof of a small wooden pagoda. 
02:13~02:21 Bai Sankong calls out to the Supervisor, taunting him by saying that he has mastered the Ultimate Unyielding Technique and that the Supervisor cannot hurt him. Bai Sankong then tells the Supervisor to take his playing to the King of Hell. The Supervisor throws the Guqin at Bai Sankong, but Bai Sankong dodges it.
02:21~02:34 The Supervisor attacks Bai Sankong. The two men fight, again using the Guqin as a weapon. The Supervisor uses the Guqin to defend himself, blocking Bai Sankong's attacks and knocking him back to the ground.
02:34~02:41 Bai Sankong calls out to the Supervisor again, repeating that he has mastered the Ultimate Unyielding Technique and cannot be hurt. Once again, he tells the Supervisor to take his playing to the King of Hell.
02:42~02:56 The Supervisor uses the Guqin to launch a powerful attack at Bai Sankong, knocking him over the railing of the pagoda and onto the lower platform. The Supervisor walks up to Bai Sankong and kicks the Guqin onto his chest, looking down on him with disdain.
02:56~03:00 The Supervisor glares at Bai Sankong. Bai Sankong looks back at him, silently. The camera pans to the Guqin on Bai Sankong’s chest. The Supervisor plucks a single string of the Guqin, creating a sharp sound that echoes through the air. The film ends.

movie101_7173948149160116773_5460_5640:

00:10~00:18 Duchess Tuo Chen pulls out a knife, and blood drips from the blade, stabbing someone in the back. Mu Lang looks shocked and pained. 
00:19~00:29 Duchess Tuo Chen raises her knife and stands facing Mu Lang, who remains motionless. The sun shines behind them. They hold their weapons in position, waiting for the moment to strike. Duchess Tuo Chen throws the knife. Mu Lang turns his body and avoids the attack. The knife falls to the ground, landing between their feet.
