movie101_7176565114756137528_60_240:
00:00~00:19 A black car enters a military compound. Soldiers stand in formation and salute as the car drives past.
00:19~00:23 The camera focuses on three soldiers standing on the steps of a building, apparently waiting for someone. One of them, Lu Xiao, addresses the other two, confirming the arrival of someone.
00:23~00:29 The car stops in front of the building, and one of the soldiers opens the door.  A young man in a military uniform exits the car.
00:29~00:37 The young man salutes the three soldiers on the steps. One of the soldiers, Che Zhen Shan, introduces himself as the commander of the 101st Regiment and welcomes the young man, identifying him as Secretary Yang.
00:38~01:04 Secretary Yang replies that he is there to learn. Che Zhen Shan explains that he was supposed to greet Secretary Yang personally, but was unable to due to urgent matters. Che Zhen Shan invites Secretary Yang to a welcome banquet at the Si Xi Grand Hotel in Liucheng.
01:04~01:29 The scene shifts to a private room, where Lu Xiao is speaking with a man, Hong Zichen. Lu Xiao briefs Hong Zichen on his mission: he is to infiltrate the Nationalist 101st Regiment, impersonate the secretary of a captured special envoy named Yang Mohan, and obtain a code, emphasizing that it should be done through clever means and not by force.
01:30~01:40 The scene shifts back to the military compound, where Hong Zichen, now in uniform and impersonating Yang Mohan, is walking with several soldiers, including Che Zhen Shan. Che Zhen Shan praises Hong Zichen for being so young yet gaining the appreciation of the special envoy and mentions his bright future.
01:40~01:53 Che Zhen Shan suggests that Hong Zichen bring his family for some fun, to which Hong Zichen replies that he's not married yet. One of the soldiers, Che Linlin, walks past carrying a bowl of soup. Che Zhen Shan explains that she is his daughter and is responsible for radio translation work, but her mood hasn't been good since she got frightened a few days ago.
01:54~02:04 The scene shifts to a room where Che Zhen Shan introduces Che Linlin to Hong Zichen. He reiterates that she's been in charge of radio translation and that she’s been in a bad mood recently, hoping that Hong Zichen will understand. 
02:04~02:23 Hong Zichen suggests inviting Che Linlin to join them for a few drinks to help ease her mood. Che Zhen Shan initially hesitates, but then agrees.
02:23~02:30 Che Zhen Shan calls out to his daughter and relays Hong Zichen’s invitation to dine at the Si Xi Grand Hotel. Che Linlin appears on a balcony overlooking the room and nods silently. 
02:31~02:41 The scene shifts to a snowy night.  Hong Zichen is walking down a street when he sees an old lady and a child begging for money. He gives them some money, and the old lady expresses her gratitude, calling him a good person.
02:42~02:47 The scene shifts to a restaurant where Che Linlin and Hong Zichen are having a meal. Che Linlin reminisces about the day they met, saying it was snowing and very cold. She mentions that the old lady said something, but trails off.
02:48~02:57 Hong Zichen interrupts, suggesting that she must be mistaken about who helped her. Che Linlin insists that it was him.  Hong Zichen insists that he has never been to Liucheng before.
02:58~03:00 Che Linlin is confused and expresses that this is strange.
movie101_7176565114756137528_240_420:
00:00~00:03 Che Linlin, a female military officer, questions Yang Muchen, a male military officer, about where they have met before. 
00:03~00:07 Yang Muchen jokingly suggests it could have been in a dream.
00:08~00:12  Yang Muchen asks Che Linlin if she has read Tang Xianzu's "The Peony Pavilion."
00:12~00:14 Che Linlin acknowledges that Yang Muchen is familiar with the play.
00:15~00:27 Yang Muchen recites a passage from "The Peony Pavilion" about love, life, and death, implying that even feelings in dreams can be real.
00:28~00:31 Che Linlin notes that Yang Muchen seems to know a lot about "The Peony Pavilion."
00:32~00:36 Che Zhenshan, a higher-ranking officer, remarks that Yang Muchen is a top graduate of Huangpu Military Academy.
00:38~00:44 Yang Muchen humbly agrees, explaining that he enjoyed opera since childhood and went to Japan to study after graduating from Huangpu.
00:44~00:50 Che Linlin asks if Yang Muchen has been to Japan, to which he confirms and inquires about her experience as well.
00:51~00:53 Che Linlin asks Yang Muchen for his opinion on Japan.
00:54~01:27 Yang Muchen finds it difficult to sum up Japan in a few words, mentioning the Mukden Incident and the fall of the Three Northeastern Provinces as unforgivable crimes by the Japanese, but acknowledges that not all Japanese people are bad. He shifts the conversation to their current political situation, highlighting the lack of full commitment to resisting Japan from their leaders due to the policy of "pacifying internal turmoil before dealing with external aggression." He asks Che Zhenshan if he has heard of this policy.
01:29~01:38 Yang Muchen concludes that regardless of Japan's nature, it is irrelevant to them, and their current main enemy is the Communist Party.
01:40~01:44 Yang Muchen raises his glass and proposes a toast to Che Linlin. Che Zhenshan looks on with a serious expression.
01:45~01:51 Che Linlin slams her glass down and walks away from the table. Yang Muchen and Che Zhenshan both take a sip from their glasses.
01:53~02:05 Che Linlin, now dressed in civilian clothing, holds a leaf specimen while expressing her dislike for Yang Muchen, calling him a heartless Japanese lackey. Che Zhenshan stands behind her, observing.
02:06~02:24 Che Zhenshan tries to reason with Che Linlin, suggesting that Yang Muchen is simply following orders and her father's situation is no different. He points out Yang Muchen's talent and favor with Director Bai, predicting a promising future for him. 
02:25~02:26 Che Linlin dismissively asks what that has to do with her.
02:27~02:40 Che Zhenshan advises Che Linlin, reminding her of her age and urging her to move on from the past, considering her own future and that they have to continue living their lives.
02:41~02:42 Che Linlin firmly tells Che Zhenshan to stay out of her business.
02:43~02:48 Che Zhenshan expresses frustration at Che Linlin's stubbornness, reiterating that he is acting in her best interest.
02:49~02:54 Che Linlin challenges Che Zhenshan to prove his concern by driving Yang Muchen away.
02:54~02:58 Che Zhenshan explains that he cannot do that because Yang Muchen is sent from Nanjing.
02:59~03:00 Che Linlin starts to say "That" with a determined expression, leaving the sentence unfinished.

00:00~00:04 Lu Xiang, a soldier, checks the men's restroom stalls and finds them all empty.
00:04~00:17 Lu Xiang checks the stalls in the women’s restroom and spots someone hiding behind a cabinet. He pulls out his gun and shouts to the person.

02:06~02:16 Upon hearing this, Secretary Yang bursts into tears. He mourns for the commissioner and Lu Xiang tries to stop him from wailing.

movie101_7176565114756137528_960_1140:
00:00~00:06 Two military officers walk down a hallway and enter a room. One of the officers, Yang Mo Han, asks about the commissioner's condition.
00:06~00:17 Che Zhen Shan, the senior officer, tells Yang Mo Han that the commissioner has been slipping in and out of consciousness. He informs him that the commissioner is awake now and asks him to hurry inside.
00:17~00:21 Yang Mo Han enters the room where the commissioner, Bai Te Pai Yuan, lies in a bed with bandages covering his face and head. Yang Mo Han stands by the bed with a sad expression.
00:21~00:40 Yang Mo Han is escorted by Che Zhen Shan to the commissioner's bedside. Yang Mo Han is visibly emotional and Che Zhen Shan gestures for him to enter the room. Yang Mo Han walks to the commissioner's bedside and begins to cry. 
00:40~00:52 The camera focuses on the commissioner lying in the hospital bed, his face covered in bandages, a feeding tube inserted in his nose. Yang Mo Han approaches the bed, distraught, and expresses his regret for arriving too late.
00:52~00:56 Bai Te Pai Yuan attempts to speak, struggling to utter a few sounds, drawing a reaction from Yang Mo Han. Che Zhen Shan inquires about the meaning behind the commissioner's words.
00:56~01:02 Che Zhen Shan asks Yang Mo Han what Bai Te Pai Yuan meant by his sounds, while the two other officers stand solemnly behind him. Yang Mo Han, still emotional, reveals that the commissioner asked him to come closer.
01:02~01:19 Yang Mo Han, with tears streaming down his face, reveals his identity as Xiao Yang, also known as Yang Mo Han, to the commissioner. He assures the commissioner that everything will be alright. 
01:19~01:34 Bai Te Pai Yuan attempts to speak again, his voice strained. Yang Mo Han comforts him, repeatedly assuring him that he will be okay. Bai Te Pai Yuan makes a final sound before falling silent.
01:34~01:47 Yang Mo Han rises from his position beside the bed, visibly shaken. He turns to Che Zhen Shan and the other officers, informing them that the commissioner was worried about not surviving and wanted to speak with him privately. Che Zhen Shan suggests they leave the room so Yang Mo Han can have some privacy with the commissioner. They all exit the room.
01:47~02:08 Yang Mo Han is left alone in the room with the motionless commissioner. He walks slowly around the bed, deep in thought. He pauses, looking at the commissioner, and his face hardens with determination. He then leans down and whispers something to the commissioner, his words inaudible.
02:08~02:22 Yang Mo Han walks urgently to the door and calls out for a doctor and the commander. Che Zhen Shan and a group of doctors and nurses rush into the room. They gather around the commissioner's bed while Yang Mo Han looks on anxiously.
02:22~02:29 The doctor examines the commissioner and Che Zhen Shan asks how he is doing. The doctor solemnly announces that it's too late. Yang Mo Han breaks down and cries, hugging Che Zhen Shan while expressing his fear of returning to his superiors and facing a death sentence.

00:00~00:02 Che Zhenshan, a military officer, and another officer, Lu Xiao, are in a grassy field, searching for someone. Che Zhenshan calls out, demanding the hero to come out.

00:08~00:11 A group of bandits, wearing masks and armed with guns, emerge from the bushes, aiming at Mo Han and Lu Xiao. The leader of the bandits demands that the officers put down their guns.
00:12~00:19 Following the bandit leader's command, both Mo Han and Lu Xiao reluctantly drop their weapons. 
00:20~00:29 Che Zhenshan steps forward, demanding to know the whereabouts of his daughter, Lin Lin. The bandit leader confirms she is with them and asks if Che Zhenshan has brought the ransom. Che Zhenshan confirms he has brought the full amount – one hundred taels of gold.
00:30~00:41 The bandit leader instructs Che Zhenshan to put the gold down and step back twenty paces. Mo Han protests, concerned that the bandits might take the gold and not release Lin Lin. He suggests a hostage exchange – he will go alone and trade the money for Lin Lin. The bandit leader agrees to the deal. 
00:42~00:48 Mo Han leaves the bag of gold on the ground and walks towards the bandits, who bring out a young woman, Lin Lin, with a cloth gagging her mouth.
00:49~00:56 Che Zhenshan calls out to his daughter, relieved to see her unharmed. Lin Lin is released and runs towards Che Zhenshan.
00:57~01:04 Mo Han, worried for Che Zhenshan's safety, warns him to be careful and stays back, observing the situation.

02:18~02:25 A large explosion engulfs the scene, killing another bandit caught in the blast. The remaining bandits flee.

02:37~03:00 Lin Lin enters the room and rushes to Mo Han's side, relieved to see him awake. Mo Han asks where he is, and Lin Lin tells him it's the medical room. Mo Han weakly acknowledges that he is alive. Lin Lin tells him the doctor said the bullet almost hit his heart.  She expresses her remorse for misjudging him before. A tear rolls down her cheek as she looks at Mo Han, worried and thankful.

00:03~00:23 Mo Han weakly responds, saying he is the one who should be sorry. He reveals that he was unaware that Lin Lin's mother and boyfriend were both Japanese, and he apologizes again. Lin Lin is shocked and calls for the doctor in panic.

He threatens his subordinate, Lu Xiao, saying if something happens to Secretary Yang, he will take Lu Xiao's life. Lu Xiao argues back, saying his life was saved by the group leader from a pile of dead bodies and the leader can take it without a word, just for a useless secretary. Che Zhen Shan yells at him to get out.

00:06~00:08 Yu Xuan, a woman with braided hair, is tied to a wooden structure with ropes. She looks defiant and resolute.

00:48~00:51 The son expresses annoyance and frustration at his father's constant matchmaking attempts.

01:12~01:15 The son, still looking unenthusiastic, shows his father the photos on his camera.
01:16~01:27 The father, while browsing through the photos, continues to shower his son with praise, emphasizing the clarity and accuracy of his work compared to other photographers.
01:28~01:40 The scene transitions to a different setting. The father is now in a village hall, looking at the photos on his son's camera again. He scrolls through several photos, his expression shifting from lightheartedness to concern.
01:41~01:48 The scene shifts to a village hall decorated with red banners and Chinese flags. People are seated on benches, awaiting the start of an event.
01:49~02:18 The father, standing on a stage in front of the villagers, attempts to quiet the crowd. He announces that the event is the re-election meeting of the village's party organization, highlighting Mayor Yang's presence and handing over the stage to her. 
02:19~02:32 Mayor Yang takes the stage, warmly greeting the villagers and officially declaring the start of the meeting.
02:33~02:49 Mayor Yang outlines the next stage of the meeting, inviting candidates to deliver their promises. She encourages participation, prompting them to lead the way.
02:50~02:56 Two candidates, Zhang Xi, a man with a shaved head and a floral shirt, and Zhang Dong, wearing sunglasses and a suit, both eagerly volunteer to be the first to speak.
02:57~03:00 Zhang Dong confidently asserts his desire to go first, pushing past Zhang Xi to approach the stage.
movie101_7235213933035192887_2760_2940:
00:00~00:01 A man with a shaved head and a gold chain around his neck walks into a room, taking his seat among the villagers. 
00:02~00:12 A man in a black suit and sunglasses walks into a meeting room, takes off his sunglasses, and greets a panel of four people sitting at two desks. 
00:12~00:25 The man in the suit begins his speech by introducing himself as Zhang Dong, the village committee director. 
00:25~00:57 Zhang Dong summarizes his achievements in the past three years, including improving the village’s appearance and earning the village a city-level award.
00:58~01:37 Zhang Dong admits to his shortcomings, claiming that he has not done enough to boost the village's economy. He reveals that he is currently negotiating with foreign investors, hoping to attract them to invest in the village. 
01:38~01:42 A woman in the audience questions Zhang Dong about his dedication to his work, suggesting that his use of a Land Rover for work does not count as "running around tirelessly."
01:43~01:54 Zhang Dong defends himself, explaining that the Land Rover is a work necessity and that he is committed to serving the village. 
01:55~01:57  The villagers applaud, supporting Zhang Dong’s statement. 
02:03~02:20 Zhang Dong promises to personally fund the renovation of the village's ancestral hall if he is reelected, emphasizing the historical significance of the hall. 
02:21~02:34 A villager suggests that the ancestral hall renovation should be done by a professional team instead of being subcontracted to Zhang Dong's relatives. 
02:35~02:37 The villagers agree with the suggestion, prompting Zhang Dong to assure them that they can trust him. 
02:38~02:52 Zhang Dong promises again to personally fund the renovation of the village’s reservoir, emphasizing his fairness and dedication to serving the people. 
02:53~03:00 Zhang Dong concludes his speech by promising to make the village a safe and prosperous place for all residents.
movie101_7235213933035192887_2940_3120:
00:00~00:06 Zhang Dong concludes his speech about a healthy and happy life, and thanks the audience. Everyone applauds and Zhang Dong bows.
00:07~00:22 Zhang Dong drives his car on a mountain road while on a phone call. He is assured that the photos he developed are clear. Upon hearing that it's Lin Chunhu's turn to speak, Zhang Dong rushes to the venue.
00:23~00:27 Zhang Dong drives into a small village with trees and houses on both sides.
00:28~00:38 The Woman, the host, announces that Lin Chunhu, the last candidate, will take the stage. Lin Chunhu walks up to the stage from the audience and the audience claps for him.
00:39~00:48 Lin Chunhu bows to the audience and the committee after walking up to the stage.
00:48~01:29 Lin Chunhu introduces himself as Lin Chunhu, a straightforward man. He admits to making money by running a cooperative but expresses his sincere wish to do practical things for the villagers. He addresses the concerns regarding his motives and defends his integrity.
01:30~01:40 Lin Chunhu promises that he will live up to the villagers' expectations if elected and pledges to fulfill his promises during his three-year term.
01:40~01:43 The audience applauds enthusiastically and cheers for Lin Chunhu’s promises.
01:44~02:08 Lin Chunhu presents his first plan, which is to run a profitable turtle farm that all villagers can participate in. He offers free technological support and promises to distribute salaries and help expand sales channels. The audience cheers for the prospect of making money.
02:12~02:25 Lin Chunhu proposes his second plan, which is to develop a seedling market near the village at the foot of Phoenix Mountain, so villagers can sell seedlings conveniently. The audience again cheers for his practical proposal.
02:26~03:00 Lin Chunhu announces his third plan, which is to focus on the village's ecological construction. He promises to address the pollution upstream of the river and make their mother river clean and bright during his term. The audience listens attentively to his speech.
movie101_7235213933035192887_3300_3480:
00:00~00:07 In a village meeting, Zhang Xi questions the validity of Lin Chunhu's election as the president of the tortoise farming cooperative due to allegations of bribery. The Town Mayor, maintaining a neutral stance, assures an investigation into the matter.
00:07~00:41 Zhang Xi publicly accuses Lin Chunhu of bribing an elderly party member, Aunt He, with two tortoises during the election period to secure her vote. He emphasizes that any gift offered during the election is considered bribery.
00:41~01:07 Genxing's Dad vehemently defends Lin Chunhu, arguing that offering a tortoise as a gesture of kindness cannot be construed as bribery. He criticizes Zhang Xi for accusing Lin Chunhu of wrongdoing while he is engaged in good deeds.
01:08~01:15 Zhang Xi sarcastically suggests that Genxing's Dad's passionate defense might stem from personal benefits received from Lin Chunhu, further escalating the tension.
01:15~01:20  Genxing's Dad, enraged by the accusation, expresses outrage while other villagers chime in, condemning Zhang Xi's insinuations and choosing to leave the gathering.
01:21~02:09  The Town Mayor privately questions Lin Chunhu about the tortoise incident. Lin Chunhu admits to giving tortoises to Aunt He but insists it was an act of compassion, not bribery, given her ill health and loneliness. He asserts his clear conscience and dedication to serving the villagers.
02:09~02:53  Genxing's Dad brings thirty village elders to the Town Mayor, presenting a joint guarantee letter vouching for Lin Chunhu's character. They highlight his history of generosity, mentioning his annual gifts to elders and prompt financial assistance to the sick and needy.
02:54~03:00 An elderly woman underscores Lin Chunhu's selflessness, emphasizing his willingness to cover medical expenses for the village's sick and elderly, further reinforcing his reputation for kindness.
movie101_7235213933035192887_3480_3660:
00:00~00:08 The Old Man and a woman are talking to Mayor Yang. The Old Man is upset that Lin Chunhu is accused of bribery in the election and asks the Mayor to investigate the matter and clear Lin's name.
00:09~00:31 Mayor Yang comforts The Old Man and promises a fair investigation. She tells them to go home and wait for the news. The Old Man and the woman leave, and Mayor Yang smiles contentedly after they are gone.
00:32~00:34 Mayor Yang watches The Old Man and the woman walk away.
00:35~00:43 The scene changes to a group of men having a meal together in a bamboo forest. Bao Liang proposes a toast to Secretary Zhang. Zhang Dong tells everyone to keep a low profile as the town committee members haven’t been finalized yet.
00:44~01:12 Zhang Dong explains to the group that he is the best candidate for the village secretary position as the other candidates are either too old, inexperienced, or disqualified. The others agree with him.
01:13~01:37 Zhang Dong humbly claims that he didn’t want the position initially, but since the village can’t find a suitable candidate and everyone trusts him, he has accepted it.
01:38~02:20 Zhang Dong shares that he believes his election is not only by people's will but also God's will.
02:21~02:39 Zhang Dong attributes his success to his son, Xiaobao, who took a good picture that helped him in the election. He is grateful to Xiaobao and proposes a toast to Bao Liang.
02:40~02:51 One of the men suggests calling Xiaobao to join them for drinks. Bao Liang immediately stops him and insists that Xiaobao should be kept in the dark about this matter.
02:52~03:00 The scene changes to a bamboo forest where Zhang Dong is calling for his son, Mengting.
movie101_7235213933035192887_3660_3840:
00:00~00:07 Liu Mengting is upset with Zhang Xiaobao, questioning his involvement in a situation regarding his father's pig farm. She states that she has already advised his father to change his ways.
00:08~00:17 Liu Mengting shows Zhang Xiaobao a photo and questions him about it. He recognizes it as a photo he took at Aunt He's house, confused as to how it got out since only he, Liu Mengting, and Brother Chunhu were present.
00:18~00:29 Liu Mengting accuses Zhang Xiaobao of leaking the photo, leading to Brother Chunhu being falsely accused of bribery. She believes Zhang Xiaobao's father and family members are involved.
00:30~00:41 Zhang Xiaobao denies any involvement, claiming he doesn't know how the photo got out. Liu Mengting doubts him, emphasizing that it was his camera and he must know who else had access to it.
00:46~01:02 Zhang Xiaobao expresses hurt that Liu Mengting doesn't trust him after knowing him for so long. He feels disappointed and believes she is associating him with people he considers different from himself. He then leaves her sitting alone in the bamboo forest.
01:45~02:11  Scene changes to a room with a large fish tank. Zhang Xiaobao's father, Zhang Baoliang, is looking at the fish. Zhang Xiaobao enters and frantically asks his father if he has seen his camera. Zhang Baoliang denies seeing it and tells him not to go out as it is getting dark.
02:16~02:23 Zhang Xiaobao accuses his father of hiding his camera, which Zhang Baoliang eventually admits to. Zhang Xiaobao demands his camera back.
02:25~02:51 Zhang Xiaobao confronts his father about using the photo from his camera to sabotage Brother Chunhu's campaign for secretary. He believes his father is colluding with East Zhang Baoliang to prevent Brother Chunhu's plans to regulate the Mother River, potentially impacting their pig farm. 
02:52~03:00  Zhang Baoliang justifies his actions, claiming he is doing what he has to do for their survival. He is worried that if Brother Chunhu becomes secretary, their family's pig farm will suffer. The clip ends with Zhang Xiaobao looking conflicted and distressed by his father's actions.
movie101_7235213933035192887_3840_4020:
00:00~00:20 Bao Liang is complaining to his son, Xiao Bao, about their family's pig farm being leased to them every year. He believes it's because he's treated the villagers well and provided them with good food and drinks. Bao Liang then demands Xiao Bao go back to his room.
00:20~00:35 Bao Liang tries to convince his son that he only leased the pig farm for the sake of their family and that they can raise more pigs and make more money if they work together.
00:35~00:44 Xiao Bao disagrees with his father's actions and believes that what they are doing is wrong. He emphasizes the importance of having a clear conscience and says he would rather be poor than compromise his morals.
00:44~01:08  Bao Liang gets angry at his son's words and calls him a spoiled piglet. He tells him to leave if he has the guts and throws the camera at him.
01:08~01:32 Xiao Bao leaves the house with the camera, walking resolutely down the street.
01:32~01:44 Mayor Yang is interviewing a woman about Lin Chunhu's character and asking if he was involved in election bribery.
01:44~01:58 Xiao Bao interrupts the conversation and shows Mayor Yang pictures on his camera, trying to prove Lin Chunhu's innocence.
02:02~02:25 Mayor Yang addresses the villagers about the bribery case in the village's election. She announces that the investigation team has completed their investigation.
02:25~03:00 Mayor Yang announces the investigation results, clearing Lin Chunhu of any wrongdoing. She confirms that the election results stand and that Lin Chunhu will be the new Village Party Branch Secretary.
